Description: Shallow asymmetrical arsenical copper axe-head: with a convex cutting-edge and a concave butt drilled with five binding-holes. The ends of the blade are squared. The cutting edge is quite sharp and bears a number of small nicks. Before cleaning, the blade was thickly corroded. There is superficial pitting. Corrosion damage has preserved the curved line of the original haft.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (72)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
